article.headline: Furman 68, Wofford 65
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Eric Webb and Robby Bostain each scored 16 points and hit key 3-pointers in the closing minutes to lead Furman to a 68-65 win over Wofford on Monday night. With the Paladins (8-9, 2-4 Southern Conference) ahead 58-56 with less than three minutes to go, Bostain and Webb hit back-to-back 3-pointers in 17 seconds to stretch Furman's lead to eight. The Terriers (5-13, 0-7) again cut the deficit to two on Drew Gibson's layup with 38 seconds to go. But Bostain hit a pair of free throws with 9.2 seconds left to seal the win. Furman had 44 rebounds to 28 for Wofford, but the Terriers had 11 steals and forced 15 Paladin turnovers. Shane Nichols scored 19 points and Gibson added 17 points and six rebounds for Wofford, who has lost 12 of its last 13 games. Moussa Diagne scored 15 points and Alex Opacic added 10 points for Furman, who snapped a three-game losing streak.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
